steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"fhrhl","text":"The protocols provided below are routinely applied by prof. Nicola Segata Lab and are based on results by the International Human Microbiome Standards (IHMS) consortium.  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8oahm","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ci9t6","text":"Before starting a metagenomic project/experiment, a list of considerations and control must be taken into account:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"418vm","text":"Work in a clean environment, meaning cleaning regularly surfaces and equipment with 1% (vol/vol) sodium hypochlorite solution, and/or UV exposure in addition to cleaning with 70% (vol/vol) ethanol.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fblgk","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"62vt3","text":"When possible, DNA/RNA isolation, PCR amplification / library preparation, and analysis should occur in physically separate areas. Mostly important is to keep separated the handling of high microbial mass biomass samples (e.g. fecal, sewage, soil) and DNA/RNA isolation to avoid cross contamination.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"qpol","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1t05k","text":"To avoid batch effects, all samples should be extracted around the same time, using DNA/RNA isolation kits and supplies purchased around the same time.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3hvla","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fhce","text":"For each extracted sample, record the date, lot number of the DNA/RNA isolation kit, name of individual who performed the DNA/RNA isolation, and any other aspects that may impact on inferred microbial community composition. ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"e0vv9","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9cetu","text":"Perform DNA/RNA-extraction controls, such as i) a DNA/RNA extraction (blank/negative) control in each batch of DNA/RNA-extractions; ii) when using swabs, filters and/or other devices for collecting samples check the DNA/RNA content from unused swabs, filters, or other. ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
